What are you doing in the laboratory? Inverse element-based magic? Hmm. The residing genius in science, #b#p2012017##k, knows magic as well as science. I've never heard about inverse element-based magic! It's nonsense!

Summon is when you call your loyal servant using magic. Think of it as an elemental familiar. Usually, Summon must have the same or similar power as you. If you Summon according to inverse element-based magic, it's possible to create a Fire creature if you were a Ice/Lightning ArchMage for instance.

If a human learns two different kinds of magic, they collide. Other element-based magic can be realized outside these normal laws via Summon. That is the principle of an #binverse element-based magic summon. Hahaha! What do you think of my idea? Crazy, yet perfect right?

It sounds interesting, though. Scientists never mind common sense! I'll help you out! The reason you can't learn two element-based magic is two different magic will always conflict with one another. Fire melts Ice, that sort of thing. What try saying... #bsummon#k!
Good! You agree with my idea! Go and get ingredients to make #b#t4031451##k! I need #b10 #t04011005#, 5 #t04011003#, 5 #t04011002##k, and #b#t4031468##k. We shall put this to the test!
It's not easy to get #b#t4031468##k. Go to #b#p2030012##k who knows well about such ingredients. He will know how to make everything you need. Take care!
Oh! You gathered everything! Good. Let's make\r\n#b#t4031451##k! It'll take time. Please talk to me in a few moments.
A blueprint for #b#t4031451##k is ready! Go and get ingredients!
